docblock.description: Create a consumer key for the user
docblock.long-description: creates a consumer for the user. if creating, returns the consumer with additional keys: consumer_key, consumer_secret. possible keys for consumer are: requester_name, requester_email, callback_uri, application_uri, application_title, application_descr application_notes, application_commercial

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with keys 'token' and 'token_secret' which can be used to sign requests.

docblock.long-description: Checks if user has access to do task

tag.name: param
tag.description: The id of the user to test

tag.name: param
tag.description: The id of the level of the user

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whether or not user with $user_id can modify $object

docblock.description: Crazy function that allows extra where field to be used for user fetching/unique checking etc.
docblock.long-description: Basically this allows users to be unique based on one other thing than the identifier which is helpful for sites using multiple domains on a single database.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Phil Sturgeon

docblock.description: A utility function for a common case of XML parsing.
docblock.long-description: It returns the value for the first occurrence of the given tag name. It requires the parsing arrays returned from xml_parse_into_struct()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the tag to search for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The indices of all the tags parsed into an array by xml_parse_into_struct

tag.name: param
tag.description: The values of all the tags parsed into an array by xml_parse_into_struct

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the tag isn't found, this value is returned instead. Defaults to an empty string

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the first tag, or the default

docblock.description: A utility function for a common case of XML parsing.
docblock.long-description: It returns the value for the given attribute of the first occurrence of the given tag name. It requires the parsing arrays returned from xml_parse_into_struct()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the tag to search for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the attribute within the tag to search for

tag.name: param
tag.description: The indices of all the tags parsed into an array by xml_parse_into_struct

tag.name: param
tag.description: The values of all the tags parsed into an array by xml_parse_into_struct

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the tag isn't found, this value is returned instead. Defaults to an empty string

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the first tag, or the default

docblock.description: A utility function to make sure that the API call succeeded

tag.name: param
tag.description: The result from the Http request call

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whether the call succeeded

docblock.description: A utility function to sign an Amazon REST API call See http://www.a2sdeveloper.com/page-rest-authentication-for-php4.html

tag.name: param
tag.description: The original URL for the API call

tag.name: return
tag.description: The input URL with the timestamp and signature parameters added

docblock.description: This is a utility function that takes an XML string and returns the contents as a native PHP array, to make it easier to work with.
docblock.long-description: The main work is done by the recursive function convert_xml_element_to_array()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The contents of an XML file

tag.name: return
tag.description: All the tags in the XML converted into a nested associative array

docblock.description: This is a utility function that takes a simpleXMLElement object and returns the contents as a nested associative PHP array, to make it easier to work with.
docblock.long-description: It's called recursively to deal with an entire document. Adapted from http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/xml/library/x-xml2jsonphp/

tag.name: param
tag.description: A single element, possibly containing children

tag.name: param
tag.description: The depth of the call stack

tag.name: return
tag.description: All the tags in the XML element converted into an associative array

docblock.description: This is a utility function to check whether a URL is reachable

tag.name: param
tag.description: The address to check

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whether the URL could be reached

docblock.description: This is an implementation of the WebFinger protocol in PHP.
docblock.long-description:
The initial version is heavily based on DeWitt Clinton's Python library: http://code.google.com/p/webfingerclient-dclinton and Brad Fitzpatrick's walkthrough of the Gmail implementation of the protocol: https://groups.google.com/group/webfinger/browse_thread/thread/fb56537a0ed36964?pli=1

Licensed under the 2-clause (eg no advertising requirement) BSD license, making it easy to reuse for commercial or GPL projects:

(c) Pete Warden pete@petewarden.com http://petewarden.typepad.com/ Feb 14th 2010

Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

  1. Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
  2. Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.

tag.description: The email address of the user

tag.name: return
tag.description: The URL to call to get information, or null if none found

docblock.description: A utility function to extract a domain name from an email address
Searches for user information using webfinger, given an email address.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The email address of the user

tag.name: return
tag.description: : of user info arrays, containing service_name, display_name, user_name, user_id, portrait_url and location for any found users. If no users were found, the result will be an empty array, and any entry may also be an empty string

docblock.long-description:
This class is based on a library I found at PHPClasses: http://phpclasses.org/package/2495-PHP-Pack-and-unpack-files-packed-in-ZIP-archives.html

The original library is a little rough around the edges so I refactored it and added several additional methods -- Phil Sturgeon

This class requires extension ZLib Enabled.

tag.description: Alexandre Tedeschi

tag.description: Phil Sturgeon

docblock.long-description:
Gets an array of activity objects based on criteria in $where

$where can either be an array like array('column_name' => 'value to match') or a mysql WHERE clause, e.g. 'activity.site = 1'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The where clause (see description)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The maximum number of results to return

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of activities matching the clauses

tag.name: param
tag.description: The id of the activity to fetch

tag.name: return
tag.description: An object representing the fetched activity

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Document properly

docblock.long-description:
Add a new activity into the database.

$activity_info should be an assoc. array where all the keys are activity table column names.

$activity_data is an array which will be json_encoded and stored in the mysql table

Example Parameters

$activity_info['site_id'] = 1;
$activity_info['user_id'] = 1;
$activity_info['verb'] = 'post';
$activity_info['module'] = 'home';
$activity_info['type'] = 'status';

$activity_data['title'] = false;
$activity_data['content'] = 'Hello world, this is a status update';
$activity_data['url'] = 'http://example.com/home/view/1';

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array containing activity metadata

tag.name: param
tag.description: The activity data

tag.name: return
tag.description: The id of the inserted activity, or false on failure

docblock.long-description: Note: This does not actually delete the activity, it just gives it a deleted status

tag.name: param
tag.description: The id of the activity to delete

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true all the time

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Make this return false if things didnâ€™t go to plan

docblock.long-description:
Creates a new category from $category_data, which is an assoc. array with keys named after column names in the category table.

Example Params:

$category_data['parent_id'] = 1;
$category_data['content_id'] = 5;
category_data['site_id'] = 1;
$category_data['user_id'] = 1;
$category_data['access'] = 1;
$category_data['module'] = 'home';
$category_data['type'] = '';
$category_data['category'] = 'Category Name';
$category_data['category_url'] = '';
$category_data['description'] = 'This is some demo category';
$category_data['details'] = '';

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data to add to the DB

tag.name: return
tag.description: The inserted data

tag.description: Improve documentation example

tag.description: The id of the category to update

tag.description: Always returns true

tag.description: Make this return a more meaningful value

tag.description: The id of the category to update

tag.description: Always returns true

tag.description: Make this return more meaningful values
